meanings.definition: To divide or organize (an area) into new political districts.
meanings.sent1: The government redistricted the city to ensure fair representation.
meanings.sent2: The committee redistricted the state based on population changes.
meanings.sent3: The mayor redistricted the town, causing confusion among the residents.
meanings.sent4: The teacher redistricted the classroom seating arrangement for better group work.
meanings.sent5: The company redistricted its departments to improve efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of redrawing the boundaries of electoral districts.
meanings.sent1: After the redistricted, some voters found themselves in new districts.
meanings.sent2: The redistricted led to changes in voting patterns in the region.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected redistricted created a buzz in the local news.
meanings.sent4: The redistricted caused candidates to rethink their campaign strategies.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the redistricted was felt during the election.
